December 27, 1998: Fiction
A MAN IN FULL, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $28.95.) Life in Atlanta
on the cusp of the millennium, as Old South values collide with a new world.
BAG OF BONES, by Stephen King. (Scribner, $28.) A series of terrifying events
besets a best-selling novelist.
THE SIMPLE TRUTH, by David Baldacci. (Warner, $25.) The appeal by a man
serving a life sentence for murder creates chaos in Washington's legal community.
MIRROR IMAGE, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $26.95.) Identical twin sisters
experience quite dissimilar lives.
RAINBOW SIX, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $27.95.) An international task force
investigates worldwide terrorism.
THE POISONWOOD BIBLE, by Barbara Kingsolver. (Harper Flamingo, $26.) Five
female characters, a missionary's family, narrate this novel set in the Belgian
Congo during that country's fight for independence.
WHEN THE WIND BLOWS, by James Patterson. (Little, Brown, $25.) A young girl
helps a widow and an F.B.I. agent uncover a deadly plot.
ALL THROUGH THE NIGHT, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Simon & Schuster, $17.)
The mystery of a missing child and a missing chalice is solved in time for
Christmas.
THE VAMPIRE ARMAND, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $26.95.) The progress of an
eternally young man from ancient Constantinople to contemporary New Orleans.
MEMOIRS OF A GEISHA, by Arthur Golden. (Knopf, $25.) The life of a young
woman in wartime Kyoto.
THE LOCKET, by Richard Paul Evans. (Simon & Schuster, $15.95.) A young man
learns much about life, love and compassion while working in a nursing home.
CHARMING BILLY, by Alice McDermott. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $22.) At a party
to celebrate a man's memory, many secrets of the past come to life.
TODAY I FEEL SILLY & OTHER MOODS THAT MAKE MY DAY, by Jamie Lee
Curtis. Illustrated by Laura Cornell. (Cotler/HarperCollins, $15.95.) The ever-
changing moods of a young girl.
A NIGHT WITHOUT ARMOR, by Jewel Kilcher. (HarperCollins, $15.) The singer-
songwriter's poems.
THE NIGHT BEFORE CHRISTMAS, by Clement Moore. Illustrated by Jan Brett.
(Putnam, $16.99.) A new edition of the classic poem.
December 27, 1998
Non-Fiction
THE GREATEST GENERATION, by Tom Brokaw. (Random House, $24.95.) The
lives of men and women who came of age during the Depression and World War
II.
THE CENTURY, by Peter Jennings and Todd Brewster. (Doubleday, $60.) An
account of the 20th century, complete with photographs and first-person
narratives.
TUESDAYS WITH MORRIE, by Mitch Albom. (Doubleday, $19.95.) A sportswriter
tells of his weekly visits to his old college mentor, who was near death's door.
BLIND MAN'S BLUFF, by Sherry Sontag and Christopher Drew with Annette
Lawrence Drew. (Public Affairs, $25.) American submarine espionage from the
early cold war years to the present.
THE PROFESSOR AND THE MADMAN, by Simon Winchester. (HarperCollins,
$22.) How a murderer helped compile the Oxford English Dictionary.
THE AMERICAN CENTURY, by Harold Evans with Gail Buckland and Kevin
Baker. (Knopf, $50.) A copiously illustrated political history of the 20th century.
THE ENDURANCE, by Caroline Alexander. (Knopf, $29.95.) Ernest Shackleton's
1914 Antarctic expedition.
FOR THE LOVE OF THE GAME, by Michael Jordan. Edited by Mark Vancil.
(Crown, $50.) The N.B.A. superstar's profusely illustrated memoir.
LINDBERGH, by A. Scott Berg. (Putnam, $30.) The checkered life of Charles A.
Lindbergh.
THE TEN COMMANDMENTS, by Laura Schlessinger and Stewart Vogel. (Cliff
Street/HarperCollins, $24.) The significance of the Ten Commandments today.
BEST FRIENDS, by Sharon J. Wohlmuth and Carol Saline. (Doubleday, $24.95.)
Thirty-four accounts of relationships that became more significant than family ties,
illustrated with photographs.
A WALK IN THE WOODS, by Bill Bryson. (Broadway, $25.) A journalist hikes the
Appalachian Trail.
CONVERSATIONS WITH GOD: Book 3, by Neale Donald Walsch. (Hampton
Roads, $22.95.) More discussions of moral questions.
A PIRATE LOOKS AT FIFTY, by Jimmy Buffett. (Random House, $24.95.)
Traveling from Florida to the Amazon, the singer-songwriter reflects on his life.
THE VICTORS, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $28.) World War II
